abstractContent.text: This paper describes SYSTRAN's systems submitted to the WMT 2017 shared news translation task for English-German, in both translation directions.
Our systems are built using OpenNMT 1 , an open-source neural machine translation system, implementing sequence-to-sequence models with LSTM encoder/decoders and attention.
We experimented using mono-lingual data automatically back-translated.
Our resulting models are further hyper-specialised with an adaptation technique that finely tunes models according to the evaluation test sentences.

introductionContent.text: We participated in the WMT 2017 shared news translation task on two different translation directions: English→German and German→English.
The paper is structured as follows: Section 2 overviews our neural MT engine.
Section 3 describes the set of experiments carried out to build the English→German and German→English neural translation models.
Experiments and results are detailed in Section 3.
Finally, conclusions are drawn in Section 4.

datasetContent.text: In this section we detail the corpora and training experiments used to build our English↔German neural translation models.
